text: [Music]
hello I'm lulama a customer service
supporter at the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'll show you how to avoid future
charges when you use the AWS fre tier
let's get
started the first step to take is to
verify whether your AWS free tier period
is still active open the AWS spilling
and cost Management console from the
navigation pane choose free tier if the
table appears then your free tier is
still active this table shows the free
tier usage percentage for each service
next let's identify resources that
generate charges in your account from
the navigation pain choose
blls in the charge by service tab EXP
and each service look for service with
usage charge across AWS regions these
are the resources that you must meate to
avoid future charges to view previous
months use the drop- down
list note services that have active
resources across buing periods and have
encourage churches are outside the free
tier after you identify pable resources
you can delete stop or dominate these
resources to prevent future charges for
E2 instances navigate to the ec2 console
select any instance that you want to
terminate choose instance State and then
choose terminate
instance it's a best practice to monitor
your free tier usage closely in the free
tier usage table you can track your
service usage amount and compare to the
free
tier you can also set up free tier usage
alerts from the billing preference page
to be notified when you approach or exit
free tier limits so now you know how to
avoid future charges when you use the
AWS free
tier thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
